text.div:
SHR Encounter Profile

A statement about a planned or actual interaction between a patient and healthcare provider(s) for the purpose of providing healthcare service(s) or assessing the health status of a patient.

SHR Mapping Summary

shr.encounter.Encounter maps to Encounter:
  Entry.FocalSubject maps to patient
  OccurrenceTime maps to period
  EncounterType maps to class
  Participant maps to participant
  Participant.Practitioner maps to participant.individual
  Participant.RelatedPerson maps to participant.individual
  Participant.OccurrenceTime maps to participant.period
  Participant.ParticipationType maps to participant.type
  ProviderOrganization maps to serviceProvider
  <TBD "HealthConcern"> maps to indication

name: SHR Encounter Profile
publisher: The MITRE Corporation: Standard Health Record Collaborative
description: A statement about a planned or actual interaction between a patient and healthcare provider(s) for the purpose of providing healthcare service(s) or assessing the health status of a patient.

element.definition: A statement about a planned or actual interaction between a patient and healthcare provider(s) for the purpose of providing healthcare service(s) or assessing the health status of a patient.

constraint.human: If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT contain nested Resources
If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT contain any narrative
If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a meta.versionId or a meta.lastUpdated
If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL be referred to from elsewhere in the resource

element.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
element.comments: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation.

element.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content may not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content.
element.comments: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element as much as possible.

element.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
element.comments: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource  Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

element.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
element.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
element.comments: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative. In some cases, a resource may only have text with little or no additional discrete data (as long as all minOccurs=1 elements are satisfied).  This may be necessary for data from legacy systems where information is captured as a "text blob" or where text is additionally entered raw or narrated and encoded in formation is added later.

element.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
element.comments: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.definition: The date when the provider received a referral for service. A referral includes an oral, written, faxed or electronic request for services made by the client or on the client�s behalf.
The type of person or entity that instigated the encounter.

Services and space and equipment provided for a particular purpose; a building or place that provides a particular service or is used for a particular industry. Could be a clinical site, community site, or a mobile facility.
Whether the patient is undergoing treatment voluntarily, or under a legal order.
The source of payment for the current encounter.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
element.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.definition: True if the encounter did not occur.

element.short: Identifier(s) by which this encounter is known
element.definition: Identifier(s) by which this encounter is known.

element.short: planned | arrived | in-progress | onleave | finished | cancelled | entered-in-error
element.definition: planned | arrived | in-progress | onleave | finished | cancelled | entered-in-error.

mapping.map: No clear equivalent in HL7 v2; active/finished could be inferred from PV1-44, PV1-45, PV2-24; inactive could be inferred from PV2-16

element.definition: The status history permits the encounter resource to contain the status history without needing to read through the historical versions of the resource, or even have the server store them.
element.comments: The current status is always found in the current version of the resource, not the status history.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

element.short: planned | arrived | in-progress | onleave | finished | cancelled | entered-in-error
element.definition: planned | arrived | in-progress | onleave | finished | cancelled | entered-in-error.

element.short: The time that the episode was in the specified status
element.definition: The time that the episode was in the specified status.
inpatient | outpatient | ambulatory | emergency +.
Specific type of encounter (e.g. e-mail consultation, surgical day-care, skilled nursing, rehabilitation).
element.comments: Since there are many ways to further classify encounters, this element is 0..*.

element.short: Indicates the urgency of the encounter
element.definition: Indicates the urgency of the encounter.

binding.description: Indicates the urgency of the encounter.

element.short: The patient present at the encounter
element.definition: The patient present at the encounter.
element.comments: While the encounter is always about the patient, the patient may not actually be known in all contexts of use.

element.short: Episode(s) of care that this encounter should be recorded against
element.definition: Where a specific encounter should be classified as a part of a specific episode(s) of care this field should be used. This association can facilitate grouping of related encounters together for a specific purpose, such as government reporting, issue tracking, association via a common problem.  The association is recorded on the encounter as these are typically created after the episode of care, and grouped on entry rather than editing the episode of care to append another encounter to it (the episode of care could span years).

element.short: The ReferralRequest that initiated this encounter
element.definition: The referral request this encounter satisfies (incoming referral).

element.short: List of participants involved in the encounter
element.definition: The list of people responsible for providing the service.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.definition: Role of participant in encounter.
element.comments: The participant type indicates how an individual partitipates in an encounter. It includes non-practitioner participants, and for practitioners this is to describe the action type in the context of this encounter (e.g. Admitting Dr, Attending Dr, Translator, Consulting Dr). This is different to the practitioner roles which are functional roles, derived from terms of employment, education, licensing, etc.

element.short: Period of time during the encounter that the participant participated
element.definition: The period of time that the specified participant participated in the encounter. These can overlap or be sub-sets of the overall encounter's period.

element.short: Persons involved in the encounter other than the patient
element.definition: Persons involved in the encounter other than the patient.

element.short: The appointment that scheduled this encounter
element.definition: The appointment that scheduled this encounter.

element.short: The start and end time of the encounter
element.definition: The start and end time of the encounter.
element.comments: If not (yet) known, the end of the Period may be omitted.

element.short: Quantity of time the encounter lasted (less time absent)
element.definition: Quantity of time the encounter lasted. This excludes the time during leaves of absence.
element.comments: May differ from the time the Encounter.period lasted because of leave of absence.

mapping.map: (PV1-45 less PV1-44) iff ( (PV1-44 not empty) and (PV1-45 not empty) ); units in minutes

element.definition: Reason the encounter takes place, expressed as a code. For admissions, this can be used for a coded admission diagnosis.
element.comments: For systems that need to know which was the primary diagnosis, these will be marked with the standard extension primaryDiagnosis (which is a sequence value rather than a flag, 1 = primary diagnosis).

binding.description: Reason why the encounter takes place.

mapping.map: EVN-4 / PV2-3 (note: PV2-3 is nominally constrained to inpatient admissions; HL7 v2 makes no vocabulary suggestions for PV2-3; would not expect PV2 segment or PV2-3 to be in use in all implementations )

element.definition: Reason the encounter takes place, as specified using information from another resource. For admissions, this is the admission diagnosis. The indication will typically be a Condition (with other resources referenced in the evidence.detail), or a Procedure.
element.comments: For systems that need to know which was the primary diagnosis, these will be marked with the standard extension primaryDiagnosis (which is a sequence value rather than a flag, 1 = primary diagnosis).

mapping.map: Resources that would commonly referenced at Encounter.indication would be Condition and/or Procedure. These most closely align with DG1/PRB and PR1 respectively.

element.short: The set of accounts that may be used for billing for this Encounter
element.definition: The set of accounts that may be used for billing for this Encounter.
element.comments: The billing system may choose to allocate billable items associated with the Encounter to different referenced Accounts based on internal business rules.

element.short: Details about the admission to a healthcare service
element.definition: Details about the admission to a healthcare service.
element.comments: An Encounter may cover more than just the inpatient stay. Contexts such as outpatients, community clinics, and aged care facilities are also included.The duration recorded in the period of this encounter covers the entire scope of this hospitalization record.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. element.definition: Pre-admission identifier.

element.short: The location from which the patient came before admission
element.definition: The location from which the patient came before admission.

element.short: From where patient was admitted (physician referral, transfer)
element.definition: From where patient was admitted (physician referral, transfer).

binding.description: From where the patient was admitted.

element.short: The admitting diagnosis as reported by admitting practitioner
element.definition: The admitting diagnosis field is used to record the diagnosis codes as reported by admitting practitioner. This could be different or in addition to the conditions reported as reason-condition(s) for the encounter.

element.short: The type of hospital re-admission that has occurred (if any). If the value is absent, then this is not identified as a readmission
element.definition: Whether this hospitalization is a readmission and why if known.

binding.description: The reason for re-admission of this hospitalization encounter.

element.short: Diet preferences reported by the patient
element.definition: Diet preferences reported by the patient.
element.comments: For example a patient may request both a dairy-free and nut-free diet preference (not mutually exclusive).
element.requirements: Used to track patient's diet restrictions and/or preference. For a complete description of the nutrition needs of a patient during their stay, one should use the nutritionOrder resource which links to Encounter.

binding.description: Medical, cultural or ethical food preferences to help with catering requirements.

element.definition: Special courtesies (VIP, board member).
Wheelchair, translator, stretcher, etc.

element.short: Location to which the patient is discharged
element.definition: Location to which the patient is discharged.

element.short: Category or kind of location after discharge
element.definition: Category or kind of location after discharge.

element.short: The final diagnosis given a patient before release from the hospital after all testing, surgery, and workup are complete
element.definition: The final diagnosis given a patient before release from the hospital after all testing, surgery, and workup are complete.

element.short: List of locations where the patient has been
element.definition: List of locations where  the patient has been during this encounter.
element.comments: Virtual encounters can be recorded in the Encounter by specifying a location reference to a location of type "kind" such as "client's home" and an encounter.class = "virtual".

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

element.definition: The location where the encounter takes place.
The status of the participants' presence at the specified location during the period specified. If the participant is is no longer at the location, then the period will have an end date/time.
element.comments: When the patient is no longer active at a location, then the period end date is entered, and the status may be changed to completed.

element.short: Time period during which the patient was present at the location
element.definition: Time period during which the patient was present at the location.

element.short: The custodian organization of this Encounter record
element.definition: An organization that is in charge of maintaining the information of this Encounter (e.g. who maintains the report or the master service catalog item, etc.). This MAY be the same as the organization on the Patient record, however it could be different. This MAY not be not the Service Delivery Location's Organization.

mapping.map: PV1-10 / PL.6  & PL.1  (note: HL7 v2 definition is "the treatment or type of surgery that the patient is scheduled to receive"; seems slightly out of alignment with the concept name 'hospital service'. Would not trust that implementations apply this semantic by default)

element.short: Another Encounter this encounter is part of
element.definition: Another Encounter of which this encounter is a part of (administratively or in time).
element.comments: This is also used for associating a child's encounter back to the mother's encounter.Refer to the Notes section in the Patient resource for further details.

element.definition: A statement about a planned or actual interaction between a patient and healthcare provider(s) for the purpose of providing healthcare service(s) or assessing the health status of a patient.
